page.title: 17ENTRIES IN KELLY'S DIRECTORY
page.content: {1895 - Eye}is a village,township and parish between the two roads leading from Leominster to Ludlow, with a station called Berrington and Eye on the{London and North Western and Great {Western joint railway from Shrewsbury {to Hereford.}The parish is divided into two townships,{Eye,Ashton and {Moreton}being one,{Luston}being the other. The area of the entire parish is 4,307 acres, population was 315 in 1891. Rateable value is Â£4,830. {1909}- Area 2719 acres land, 17 water. Rateable value Â£4,603. Population in 1901 was 315. {1922}- Area the same. Rateable value Â£4,259.Population in 1911 was 305. {1929}- Area the same. Population in 1921 was 288. Principal landowner Lord Cawley of Ashton Manor. {1941}- Area the same. Population in the census of 1931 was 251.
